subject: Re: Thoreau's Civil Disobedience now in ePub
messageBody:
Sweet.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Nathan Sharfi <bonusfrogs@...> wrote:
>
> I've updated <https://github.com/adiabatic/qs-literature> with Tim Rice's latest.
>
> Direct links for people who hate clicking:
>
> * <http://adiabatic.github.io/qs-literature/civil-disobedience.html>
> * <http://adiabatic.github.io/qs-literature/civil-disobedience.epub>
>
> I'm a fan of putting spaces around em dashes, but I haven't done that yet. I'll probably get around to it in the coming week or so.
>
> The Call of Cthulhu has also gotten minor updates, mostly around pages 1 and 2. Its default iTunes metadata has also been updated, putting it in the "Quikscript" category along with Thoreau.
>
> Incidentally, does anyone here have enough taste and font-making skills to add a decent pair (or two) of curly quotation marks to <https://github.com/adiabatic/qs-literature/blob/gh-pages/kingsley.otf>? I've managed to shrink the period, comma, semicolon, and colon down to sensible sizes that harmonize well with the rest of the typeface, but there doesn't seem to be any good curly quotes in U+201C, U+201D, U+2018, and U+2019.
>
